details.description: A traditional Valencian rice dish, often made with seafood and seasoned with saffron.
steps: Step 1: Sauté vegetables and meats in a large pan.
Step 2: Add rice and saffron, then pour in broth.
Step 3: Add seafood and cook until rice is tender.
Step 4: Let the paella rest before serving.

details.description: A cold tomato soup originating from Andalusia, perfect for hot summer days.
steps: Step 1: Blend tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, onion, and garlic.
Step 2: Add olive oil, vinegar, and seasoning, then blend again.
Step 3: Chill the soup in the refrigerator.
Step 4: Serve cold, optionally with chopped vegetables on top.

details.description: A Spanish omelette made with potatoes and onions, cooked in olive oil.
steps: Step 1: Slice and fry potatoes and onions in olive oil until tender.
Step 2: Beat eggs and mix with the cooked potatoes and onions.
Step 3: Pour the mixture back into the pan and cook until set.
Step 4: Flip the tortilla to cook the other side.

details.description: Fried potatoes served with a spicy tomato sauce, a popular tapa.
steps: Step 1: Cut potatoes into cubes and fry in olive oil until crispy.
Step 2: Prepare the bravas sauce by sautéing garlic and adding tomatoes and paprika.
Step 3: Add vinegar to the sauce and simmer until thickened.
Step 4: Serve the fried potatoes topped with the sauce.

details.description: Fried dough pastry, often served with hot chocolate for dipping.
steps: Step 1: Mix flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
Step 2: Pipe the dough into hot oil and fry until golden.
Step 3: Remove churros and drain on paper towels.
Step 4: Roll churros in sugar and cinnamon, then serve.

details.description: A popular Portuguese dish made with shredded salt cod, onions, and thinly sliced potatoes, mixed with eggs.
steps: Step 1: Soak and shred the salt cod.
Step 2: Fry thinly sliced potatoes until crispy.
Step 3: Sauté onions until soft, then add the shredded cod.
Step 4: Mix in the fried potatoes and beaten eggs, cook until eggs are set.
Step 5: Garnish with black olives and parsley.

details.description: A traditional Portuguese soup made with kale, potatoes, and chorizo.
steps: Step 1: Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil.
Step 2: Add potatoes and water, cook until potatoes are tender.
Step 3: Mash the potatoes to create a thick broth.
Step 4: Add thinly sliced kale and chorizo, simmer until kale is tender.
Step 5: Serve hot.

details.description: Portuguese custard tarts with a crispy, flaky crust and creamy custard filling.
steps: Step 1: Roll out puff pastry and cut into circles, place in muffin tins.
Step 2: Whisk egg yolks, sugar, flour, and milk together.
Step 3: Cook the mixture over low heat until thickened.
Step 4: Pour custard into pastry shells.
Step 5: Bake until the tops are browned and the pastry is crispy.

details.description: A traditional Portuguese dish featuring octopus roasted with potatoes, garlic, and olive oil.
steps: Step 1: Boil the octopus until tender.
Step 2: Roast potatoes with garlic and olive oil.
Step 3: Place the boiled octopus in a baking dish with the potatoes.
Step 4: Drizzle with more olive oil and bake until golden.
Step 5: Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

details.description: A seafood rice dish made with a variety of shellfish, tomatoes, and a flavorful broth.
steps: Step 1: Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil.
Step 2: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 3: Stir in rice and cook briefly.
Step 4: Add broth and shellfish, cook until rice is tender and seafood is cooked.
Step 5: Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs.

details.description: A layered casserole made with eggplant, ground beef, and béchamel sauce.
steps: Step 1: Slice and fry the eggplant and potatoes.
Step 2: Sauté onions and ground beef, add tomatoes and seasonings.
Step 3: Layer eggplant, potatoes, and meat sauce in a baking dish.
Step 4: Pour béchamel sauce over the top and bake until golden brown.

details.description: A savory pie made with spinach, feta cheese, and layers of crispy phyllo dough.
steps: Step 1: Sauté onions and spinach until wilted.
Step 2: Mix spinach with feta cheese and dill.
Step 3: Layer phyllo dough in a baking dish, brushing each layer with olive oil.
Step 4: Add spinach mixture and top with more phyllo layers, then bake until golden.

details.description: Grilled skewers of marinated pork, often served with pita and tzatziki.
steps: Step 1: Cut pork into cubes and marinate in lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, and oregano.
Step 2: Thread pork onto skewers.
Step 3: Grill skewers until meat is cooked through.
Step 4: Serve with pita bread and tzatziki sauce.

details.description: A refreshing yogurt and cucumber dip flavored with garlic and dill.
steps: Step 1: Grate the cucumber and squeeze out excess water.
Step 2: Mix yogurt with grated cucumber, garlic, and dill.
Step 3: Add lemon juice and olive oil, then mix well.
Step 4: Chill before serving.

details.description: A sweet pastry made with layers of phyllo dough, nuts, and honey syrup.
steps: Step 1: Layer phyllo dough in a baking dish, brushing each layer with butter.
Step 2: Sprinkle chopped nuts and cinnamon between layers.
Step 3: Bake until golden and crisp.
Step 4: Pour honey syrup over the hot baklava and let it soak in before serving.

details.description: A classic French dish of chicken braised with wine, mushrooms, and bacon.
steps: Step 1: Brown the chicken pieces in a large pot.
Step 2: Sauté bacon, mushrooms, onions, and garlic in the same pot.
Step 3: Add chicken back to the pot and pour in red wine.
Step 4: Simmer until the chicken is tender.

details.description: A vegetable stew made with eggplant, zucchini, peppers, and tomatoes, flavored with herbs.
steps: Step 1: Slice and sauté the vegetables separately in olive oil.
Step 2: Layer the vegetables in a baking dish.
Step 3: Season with herbs and bake until tender.
Step 4: Serve warm or at room temperature.

details.description: A savory pie filled with eggs, cream, bacon, and cheese.
steps: Step 1: Pre-bake the pie crust.
Step 2: Cook bacon and onions until crisp and tender.
Step 3: Whisk eggs and cream, then mix with bacon and onions.
Step 4: Pour the mixture into the crust and bake until set.

details.description: A creamy custard topped with a layer of hard caramel.
steps: Step 1: Heat cream and vanilla in a saucepan.
Step 2: Whisk sugar and egg yolks, then slowly add the hot cream.
Step 3: Pour the mixture into ramekins and bake in a water bath.
Step 4: Chill, then caramelize sugar on top before serving.

details.description: A rich onion soup topped with cheese-covered bread.
steps: Step 1: Sauté sliced onions in butter until caramelized.
Step 2: Add flour and cook briefly, then pour in beef broth.
Step 3: Simmer until onions are very tender.
Step 4: Top with toasted bread and cheese, then broil until cheese is melted.

details.description: A classic Roman pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, and cured pork.
steps: Step 1: Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Step 2: Fry guanciale until crispy.
Step 3: Whisk eggs and cheese together.
Step 4: Toss hot pasta with guanciale and egg mixture, then season with pepper.

details.description: Grilled bread rubbed with garlic and topped with fresh tomatoes and basil.
steps: Step 1: Grill or toast slices of bread.
Step 2: Rub each slice with a garlic clove.
Step 3: Top with chopped tomatoes and basil.
Step 4: Drizzle with olive oil and serve.

details.description: A creamy risotto flavored with saffron, a specialty of Milan.
steps: Step 1: Sauté onions in butter, then add rice and toast briefly.
Step 2: Add white wine and cook until evaporated.
Step 3: Gradually add broth, stirring constantly, until rice is tender.
Step 4: Stir in saffron and Parmesan cheese before serving.

details.description: A layered dessert with coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cream, dusted with cocoa powder.
steps: Step 1: Beat egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale.
Step 2: Fold in mascarpone cheese.
Step 3: Dip ladyfingers in coffee and layer in a dish.
Step 4: Spread mascarpone mixture over ladyfingers and repeat layers, then dust with cocoa powder.

details.description: A simple salad of sliced tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with olive oil.
steps: Step 1: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella cheese.
Step 2: Arrange slices on a plate, alternating between tomato and mozzarella.
Step 3: Top with fresh basil leaves.
Step 4: Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
